short_summary: collection & disposal of wet organic waste
description: the work is a collection & disposal of wet organic waste in various correctional facilities across the province. the collection includes collection of organic waste in bins, removal and disposal of non-hazardous waste materials, transportation of collected waste to designated facilities for treatment and processing, and providing a monthly detailed invoice package. one of the requirements is not to use dumpsters. regular collections at specified intervals, and allowance for contingencies for unforeseen events, are also a requirement.
full_summary:
**Organic Waste Collection Tender**
### Overview

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the collection and disposal of organic waste from various sites in Kingston and Campbellford, Ontario. The RFP is open to all interested suppliers and is not subject to any set-asides for Indigenous Suppliers.

**Tender Details**

* Tender Reference Number: cb-144-90401896
* Amendment Number: 1
* Solicitation Number: 21401-27-4679334
* Publication Date: April 30, 2024
* Tender Closing Date: May 24, 2024, at 10:00 am
* Expected Contract Start Date: June 7, 2024
* Expected Contract End Date: March 31, 2027

**Description of Requirement**

The CSC has a requirement for the collection and disposal of wet organic waste, accumulated at designated sites. The contractor must provide bins of sufficient construction, configuration, and quantity to hold a full charge of waste and have on hand sufficient numbers of bins for the quantities and schedule below, including clean bin exchange.

**Tender Evaluation**

The tender evaluation will be based on the lowest price compliant bid.

** Delivery and Performance**

The contractor must collect organic waste materials from designated sites and transport them to a processing facility or intermediate transfer station. The contractor must have organic wastes processed to a commercial-grade compost product.

**Invitation to Bid**

All interested suppliers can submit a bid. The complete statement of work and evaluation criteria are available on the Canada Buys/Tender Opportunities website.

**Contact Information**

For further information, contact:
Robin Riha, Contracting Authority
Phone: (613) 328-9727
Email: robin.riha@csc-scc.gc.ca

Note: The following documents are available for download from the Canada Buys/Tender Opportunities website:

* Solicitation Document
* Statement of Work
* Evaluation Criteria

The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada (English or French). After contract award, bidders may request a debriefing on the results of the bid solicitation process. The Crown will provide a free downloadable publication on the procurement process, including a guide on "Selling to the Government." This tender is open to all qualified suppliers.  Procurement Assistance Canada (PAC) offers seminars to businesses interested in learning how to sell goods and services to the Government
